column4: and now i want to "undo" that
i cant seem to get proper routing with a normal lan connection
skype for linux gets a connection but nothing else works
i think its this line: sudo ln -sf ppp/resolv.conf /etc/resolv.conf
oh come on people: sudo ln -sf ppp/resolv.conf /etc/resolv.conf
i can see it fucks up my routing but i am not sure how to undo that
-sf doesnt show up on the man
thats a combination of 2 switches, s and f
donno. all that does is create a link between those 2 files. where do you see that line
you could delete the symbolic link. that wont effect the origonal file
what would be the command for that?
the comand "ln -sf ...." just creates a link between those 2 files, kinda sorta like copying the first on the the second one
i figured i dont want to delete /etc/resolv.conf, but ppp/resolve.conf is "overriting" it now i suppose
ok so what i have is a dns problem, how do i remove that thing so it goes back to using the lan?
remove the resolv.conf and create an empty file in its place
